subject: Baseball
lead_paragraph: Second baseman Kazuo Matsui completed a three-year, $16.5 million contract with the Houston Astros yesterday, a little more than a month after helping the Colorado Rockies to their first World Series appearance. Matsui, a 32-year-old switch-hitter, batted .288 and stole 32 bases last season. Houston stole only 65 bases, the third fewest in the National League.
